alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 06 at 9:34PM MST until August 06 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... North central Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Southwestern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1030 PM MST. * At 933 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Mount Lemmon/Summerhaven to near Catalina State Park to near Tucson Estates to 6 miles northwest of Green Valley, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 247. Route 77 between mile markers 84 and 97. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 128. Route 86 between mile markers 108 and 156. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Route 286 between mile markers 30 and 45. Locations impacted include... Catalina, Oro Valley, Marana, Sells, Eloy, Saddlebrooke, Three Points, Avra Valley, Tortolita, Santa Rosa, Picacho, Chui-Chu, San Isidro, Saguaro National Park West, Picacho Peak State Park, Kitt Peak, Tucson Estates, Picture Rocks, Red Rock and Cactus Forest. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
